page.title: 04Glenrothes
page.content: Glenrothes got its name from the Leslies of Rothes who owned the estates around Glenrothes.Glen came into Glenrothes because we are in a valley.On our coat of arms we have two oak trees which represent Fythkill, Leslie.There is a chevron on the otters head from the arms of Balfour of Balbirnie.There are wavy lines to represent the river Leven.At the bottom there is a winding wheel to represent the miners and the colliery. The motto is"EX TERRA VIS". Pitteuchar was built in the late 60s and early 70s.The first building to take place was at the primary school in the south of the precinct. Building continued through the 70s as the precinct of Stenton took shape. Though there is an industrial estate nearby,local people find work over a wide geographical area.
